title: Enterprise AI Machine Learning Using Cloudera
description: This course covered generative AI, large language models, vector databases, and application development within Cloudera Machine Learning.

title: Cloudera Apache Iceberg Training
description: This course covered Apache Iceberg, data snapshots, versioning, and more within Cloudera services.

title: Cloudera Data Governance Training
description: This course covered the Atlas data catalog and Ranger security and access control services in Cloudera.

title: Cloudera Spark Developer Training
description: This course covered Spark, Hive, HDFS, Cloudera Machine Learning, and more.

title: Cloudera Streaming Analytics Training
description: This course covered Flink and Kafka streaming technologies.

title: Cloudera Data Science Training
description: This course covered Spark, Cloudera Data Science workbench, supervised and unsupervised learning, and more.

title: Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) Product Owner / Product Manager Training
description: This training covered the Scaled Agile Framework for project management, requirements gathering, estimating work, and so on.

title: Coursera: Machine Learning
description: Online course on Machine Learning taught by Stanford professor Andrew Ng.

title: Apache Spark Programming (DB 105)
description: This course covered the fundamentals of Apache Spark including Spark’s architecture and internals, the core APIs for using Spark, SQL and other high-level data access tools, as well as Spark’s streaming capabilities and machine learning APIs.

title: Intermediate Shiny (RStudio Conference 2019)
description: This covered the basics of Shiny, reactivity, modules, and best-practices.

title: Intro to Deep Learning
description: This was an internal course offered at Sandia National Lab that covered deep learning methods.

title: Docker Fundamentals and Docker for Enterprise Developers
description: This course covered Docker fundamentals, Docker swarm, Docker compose files, YAML format, and more.

title: R and Shiny Training
description: Taught by Matt Pickard this covered the basics of R, dplyr, Shiny, and reactivity.
